The new law aims to make it cheaper and easier for more people to extend their lease, buy their freehold and take over management... Brian Wheeler

title: Ireland AM star Alan Hughes admits he’s ‘terrifed of dying’ after experiencing multiple tragic family deaths
creator: Kate Stafford
content: IRELAND AM star Alan Hughes has admitted he is "terrified of dying" after experiencing multiple tragic family deaths. The Virgin Media star first experienced grief at just 10 years old after his parents died within six months of each other. Alan has now opened up about his grief and how the passing of his loved ones has made him "more determined". Speaking to the RTE Guide , the 60-year-old discussed how he was orphaned at a young age after his mum and dad both passed away. Describing the tough time, he said: "It was a shock for all the family. She [his mother] had been unwell, so I was in her room, just lying with her and she passed." The popular presenter also went through a hard period when his sister Doreen passed away, just a year after he got married to his husband Karl Broderick. The Irish star recalled the first time his sister met his partner and laughed: "When Doreen first met Karl, she said 'I really like you but if you do anything on him, I'll come and haunt you!' "Now, when something good happens for myself and Karl I say, 'Ah they are all looking down on us." And Alan's brother David sadly died back in 2017 after a short battle with lung cancer. The TV host has highlighted how his siblings passing has made him "very determined". He said: "When you see your sister and your brother die at a youngish age, you just want to grasp life and live it. And I've always been a glass-half-full person." Alan told how he "believes there is a God" and "hopes there is a life after this one". He continued: "I hope it's where I'll meet all those family and friends I've loved, but maybe I have that hope because I'm terrified of dying." Separately, Alan recently enjoyed a "fun night" with his husband and his fans have all said they looked "very handsome". The popular presenter and his long-term partner Karl Broderick got married in October 2011, however they have been together for over 30 years . Alan and Karl recently attended the fashion event of the year at the Platinum VIP Style awards. The happy couple documented themselves getting ready for the event. Alan posted the fun video to his Instagram with the caption: "Fun fun night at the @vip.magazine style awards last Friday. "Thanks to @guyclothing in Tullamore for dressing me and @karlbroderick for the night. Thanks @luykxbianca @taradolloconnor for the invite and to @intercondublin and @nickylogue1 for the lovely stay. "So be honest who wore it better me or Karl." In the video, Alan and Karl could be seen standing in white robes as they held up suit bags with their outfits in them. The famous pair then walked towards the camera with big smiles and covered it up. In the next clip, the love birds both posed in smart suits while holding up two glasses of champagne. Alan stunned in a beautiful green blazer with a black satin trim. The 60-year-old finished off the look with a clean white shirt a black dickey bow and some black tailored trousers. Karl also looked handsome in a fun salmon coloured suit with a navy shirt underneath and matching suit trousers. The happy pair then put their champagne glasses in the air and gave a cheers. Fans and friends all flocked to the Instagram comments to share some love for the stylish couple. Martina wrote: "Very handsome men." Keenan added: "You both looked splendid. One of you should have won Best Dressed Man."

title: Beyoncé's mom makes upsetting revelation about star as she opens up about family life
creator: Hanna Fillingham
description: Beyoncé's mom Tina Knowles made an emotional revelation about the mom-of-three as she opened up about family life in a rare interview
content: oozes confidence when she's on stage and has millions of fans around the world who look up to her. What's more, the award-winning singer's life wasn't always this way, and her personality has changed a lot since her early years too. During a rare interview, her mom, Tina Knowles, gave an insight into what Beyoncé was like as a child, making the heartbreaking revelation that she was bullied for a while. Tina also disclosed that the Texas Hold 'Em hitmaker was incredibly shy as a child. The 70-year-old told Vogue: "Beyoncé, she was very shy and she got bullied a bit, but the day that she stood up for someone—she didn't stand up for herself she stood up for them. I'm getting emotional talking about it. I was just, I couldn't have been more proud of her." Tina also spoke about her other "girls", daughter Solange and Kelly Rowland, who she often refers to as her third daughter. She said: "Solange, was her signing a petition in school, she was only in, like, fifth grade and she was out getting petitions signed. So she's always been an activist. "And Kelly was always this kid that just tried to protect everybody. I have a memory of her with her best friend Barbara and her being a mediator and just being this little peacemaker." Tina adores her family and recently gave an insight into her grandchildren's personalities too. During a chat with E! News, she gave a rare insight into the lives of Beyoncé's twins Rumi and Sir, six, who unlike their sister Blue Ivy, 12, have kept a lower profile in their young lives so far. She said: "Rumi is amazing—an amazing artist, painter, and creator." Reflecting on the twins' flourishing creativity, Tina mused, "How could they be anything else growing up in that environment?" She emphasized that their family life is steeped in discussions about creativity and fashion, nurturing their innate talents from a very young age. Sir, on the other hand, shares more similarities with his father, Jay-Z. "Sir is very quiet," Tina noted, revealing that he gravitates more towards numbers than fashion. "He does all of the numbers stuff, so he's not into fashion as much," she explained, but quickly added that Sir is "very, very smart," hinting at the diverse talents the twins possess. Beyoncé shares her three children with husband Jay-Z. Despite being one of the most famous couples, they are notoriously private when it comes to their personal lives. However, in the last year, the family have been in the news more and more thanks to Beyoncé's numerous projects, from her Renaissance World Tour - which saw daughter Blue step into the spotlight and join her mom on stage - to the release of her new country music album, Cowboy Carter. During the same interview, Tina spoke of her pride for Beyoncé stepping into the country music scene, which saw her recently make history as the first Black woman to top the country charts. "We're from Texas," Tina explained. "We’ve been part of that culture for a long time, and I was very excited about it." She described Cowboy Carter as a "nice history lesson" for fans, applauding Beyoncé’s ability to educate subtly through her music. "She has this way of doing things subtly but educating, and so I’m really proud of that," Tina shared. By entering your details, you are agreeing to HELLO! Magazine User . You can unsubscribe at any time. For more information, .

title: Indigenous leaders call on federal government support for Moosonee, Ont. hospital
description: Indigenous leaders were in Ottawa on Monday, calling on the federal government to follow-through on a commitment to fund a new hospital in Moosonee, along Ontario’s James Bay coast.
content: Indigenous leaders were in Ottawa on Monday to call on the federal government to follow through on a commitment to fund a new hospital in Moosonee, along Ontario's James Bay coast. They say the federal government promised to set aside $1.3 billion to help build the hospital, but that money wasn't included in the last federal budget. The hospital would replace a 74-year-old facility in neighbouring Moose Factory, which is Canada's oldest, non-renovated hospital. "It's not just a building, it is a symbol of the enduring colonial legacy our people are forced to confront daily," said Lynne Innes, CEO of the Weeneebayko Area Health Authority, which runs health-care services in the region. The Moose Factory hospital was built in 1950 as a tuberculosis sanitorium, where children who were taken from their home communities were isolated from their families and culture. Built in 1950, the Weeneebayko hospital in Moose Factory is set to be replaced by a new regional James Bay hospital currently under construction in Moosonee. (Erik White/CBC) Because Moose Factory is on an island, patients have to be transported by helicopter to receive care. Dr. Elaine Innes, the Weeneebayko Area Health Authority's chief of staff, said patients from James Bay communities often have to travel south to Kingston, Ont., for care. "We struggle with providing specialty services," she said. "We can no longer provide obstetrical care because we no longer have the health human resources." James Bay health authority says 'huge surprise' in federal budget could halt hospital construction New Moosonee hospital to replace 74 year old facility in Moose Factory Moose Cree First Nation Chief Peter Wesley extended an invitation for Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to visit Moose Factory and see the state of the hospital. "There's no other hospital where you walk down the hallway and the roof is caving in," Wesley said. "This would not be tolerated in any other urban community. This would not be tolerated in Ottawa. This would not be tolerated in Toronto, or Sudbury. Why do we have to tolerate it as First Nations people?" National Chief of the Assembly of First Nations Cindy Woodhouse Nepinak says that in 2007, the federal government committed to help fund a new hospital in Moosonee. (Adrian Wyld/The Canadian Press) Assembly of First Nations National Chief Cindy Woodhouse Nepinak thanked the provincial government for its support on the Moosonee hospital project, but said the federal government has fallen short. "Now we need the feds to come back to the table," she said. Woodhouse Nepinak and others noted that the federal government agreed to support the new hospital in 2007, when plans were first unveiled. 'I'm not walking away from that commitment' Indigenous Services Minister Patty Hajdu previously said in the House of Commons that she remains committed to the project. "I'm not walking away from that commitment and we will get that hospital built," Hajdu said. In an email to CBC News, Indigenous Services Canada spokesperson Ryan Tyndall said the federal government's 2018 budget included $158.4 million for the construction of the hospital. But Tyndall added that health care is a provincial responsibility. He said the federal government has "significantly increased" health transfers to the provinces to support them in delivering health care. In Ontario, those transfers went from $13.1 billion in 2015 to $20.3 billion in 2024.

title: Molly-Mae and Tommy Fury enjoy lavish romantic break after 'split' rumours
creator: web.help@express.co.uk (Isobel Pankhurst)
description: Former Love Island stars Molly-Mae Hague and Tommy Fury have headed off on a romantic UK break as they put on a united front following rumours that they had split
content: Former Love Island stars Molly-Mae Hague and Tommy Fury have headed off on a romantic UK break as they put on a united front following rumours that they had split Molly-Mae Hague and Tommy Fury had shut down rumours of a split as they continue celebrating her 25th birthday. Fans had been left concerned over the pair's relationship in recent weeks, after they both jetted off away without one another. However, the pair have since put on a united front, with both Molly-Mae and Tommy sharing photos of her 25th birthday. Molly even shared a clip of Tommy surprising her with a delicious-looking birthday cake at home. And keeping the celebrations going, the former Love Island runner-ups have now headed on a romantic UK-based getaway as they and their one-year-old daughter Bambi enjoy a stay at Oxfordshire's Estelle Manor. Both Molly-Mae and Tommy have been sharing snaps and videos of their family getaway, with Tommy sharing a sweet one of Molly kissing their daughter. Sharing a photo of the lavish location, Molly-Mae quipped that she was in her " Saltburn element " while staying at the country estate turned hotel. Molly-Mae sweetly shared that Tommy had "spoilt" her with the luxury birthday getaway. After sharing a number of pics, Molly-Mae revealed that she was staying in the lavish Estelle Manor - adding that she's wanted to visit the hotel "for so long." Molly and Tommy continued to share snaps of their romantic getaway, just weeks after they each jetted off abroad - with Molly heading to her sister's hen do in Ibiza , while Tommy flew to Dubai to support his brother, Tyson Fury, in a boxing match. The couple's separate holidays raised a few eyebrows, and some eagle-eyed fans quickly pointed out that they had also not been interacting with one another on social media - with Molly-Mae even failing to publicly wish her fiance a happy birthday. After arriving back in the UK the couple shut down rumours of a split when Molly shared a photo of Tommy confirming he was back at their Cheshire home . And they have since been sharing photos of Molly's birthday celebrations in which they appear as loved-up as ever. Molly and Tommy have only continued to show that they remain solidly loved-up as they make the most of the romantic getaway. Molly-Mae shared a "special" photo of Tommy and Bambi going for a stroll hand-in-hand. Molly then shared a sweet photo of Tommy playing croquet with their one-year-old daughter.

title: Rafael Nadal provides retirement update after emotional French Open exit
description: Rafael Nadal was beaten by Alexander Zverev in the first round of the French Open on Sunday, with the 14-time champion giving an emotional speech to the crowd after the match
content: Rafael Nadal has addressed his future after a surprising first-round defeat to Alexander Zverev at the French Open. Despite avoiding direct comments about retirement, the 14-time champion in Paris hinted that this might have been his last appearance at Roland Garros. Despite a 6-3 7-6(5) 6-3 loss, Nadal believes he "was not that far off" and "had his chances" against the world No. 4, who had recently clinched the Italian Open. "I played I think at a good level in all ways, compared to the way that I was playing the weeks before. So, happy for that. Of course disappointed for losing, but in terms of body feelings, happy that I finish healthy, you know, and I had a tough battle out there. And I was ready for a little bit more," he said, before making a significant remark about his future in Paris. "So that's it. Accept the moment. If it's the last time that I played here, I am in peace with myself," he said with a smile, suggesting that he may have already bid his farewell to the French Open. "I tried everything to be ready for this tournament for almost 20 years. And today and the last two years I have been working and going through probably the toughest process in my tennis career with the dream to come back here, no? At least I did. I mean, I lost, but that's part of the business." Andy Murray's French Open journey ends in defeat to Stan Wawrinka as retirement looms World No. 1 Novak Djokovic candid about his struggles and modest hopes for French Open Despite the uncertain future for Nadal, one thing remains evident - the Spanish tennis ace is determined to participate in the upcoming Olympic Games, slated for Paris' iconic Stade Roland Garros. The 22-time Grand Slam champion revealed: "I need to finish all this process. My mindset was ready 'til Olympics, you know, and then I need to check how I feel in different ways, I mean, in terms of personal motivation, body feelings, and then in terms of the level of tennis it makes sense to keep playing." Beginning to rediscover his form, the soon-to-be 38-year-old explained: "For me the feeling of coming back home with the personal satisfaction to do all what's in my hands to make the things work well, give myself everything, that's the only way that I understand my life, you know." He further clarified. "That's why I am not saying I am retiring today. You know, at the end, it's about not having the feeling in one year or one year and a half that, you know, I didn't give myself a chance, a real chance, you know, because immediately that I started to become a little bit healthier, I stop." Nadal, who is still relishing his time on the tour, expressed his desire to continue playing "for a while". He said: "So in terms of what's driving me, what's the force behind driving me, I mean, as I said, I'm a simple guy. I enjoy what I do. You know, I am passionate about sport, I am passionate about competition. I like to practice, I like to play tennis. I'm in a different moment of my personal life too, traveling with my son, wife, you know. I am enjoying these moments that will not come back. "So if I keep enjoying doing what I am doing and I feel myself competitive and healthy enough to enjoy, I want to keep going for a while. I don't know for how long, but I want to keep going for a while, because they are having fun, I am having fun, and I need to see, I need to give myself a little bit longer chances to see if my level is growing and my body is holding, and then let's make a decision." While he hinted at the future of his career, Nadal refrained from making any official statements. "But give me two months till Olympics, and then let's see if I am able to keep going or I say, okay, guys, it's more than enough. Let's see. I mean, today is not a moment to analyze all these kinds of things. It's a moment just to keep going, accept the moment, and let's see what's going on," he concluded.

title: Shura Council reviews public discussion request on supporting national, foreign investment
creator: QNA
description: DOHA: The Shura Council held its regular weekly session at Tamim bin Hamad Hall on Monday under the chairmanship of Speaker of the Shura Council HE Hassan bin Abdullah Al Ghanim.Th...
content: QNA DOHA: The Shura Council held its regular weekly session at Tamim bin Hamad Hall on Monday under the chairmanship of Speaker of the Shura Council HE Hassan bin Abdullah Al Ghanim. The council took note of the request for public discussion submitted by a host of members of the council on supporting national and foreign investment. Speaker of the Shura Council highlighted that investment is a core pillar to advance the national economy, noting the interest of the country's wise leadership in this field as stipulated in article (28) of the constitution, which underscored that the state shall ensure freedom of economic activity based on social justice and balanced cooperation between public and private activities to further achieve economic and social development, as well as increase production. The Qatar National Vision 2030 vowed in its third pillar to develop a diversified and competitive national economy capable of meeting the current and future needs of citizens and ensuring a high standard of living, His Excellency pointed out. He highlighted some impediments facing the investment sector that should be handled by exploring appropriate solutions in the implementation of the directives of the wise leadership represented by His Highness the Amir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani, underscoring the council's keenness to strengthen the economic development and drawing investment, stemming from its role as the state's legislative authority. For their part, members of the council underlined the interest of the state's wise leadership in fostering investment, in pursuit of achieving economic development through enacting laws that encourage investment and establish institutions to help support economic diversification, in addition to upgrading small and medium-sized enterprises and providing the facilitations that attract investment and encourage investors to lend impetus to the development in the state. Members of the Shura Council highlighted a range of impediments that face the investment sector and require appropriate and rapid solutions, such as unclear procedures, the complexity of licensing procedures, lack of unification, complexities of using electronic services, overlapping requirements and standards for licensing, difficulties related to investment sites and attracting professional manpower, problems in some legislation related to the labour market, as well as rise in some government fees, et al. In their remarks before the council, the members underscored the importance of optimizing labour market and investment-related laws and legislation to ensure a stable and rewarding environment, support startups, and streamline administrative and financial procedures. Upon conclusion of the discussions, the council decided to refer the request of public discussion to the Financial and Economic Affairs Committee for further perusal and submission of its report accordingly. Additionally, the council approved the request to extend the Financial and Economic Affairs Committee's works to study the draft law on job localization in the private sector. The session discussed its delegation's participation in the 14th plenary session of the Asian Parliamentary Association (APA), and its associated meetings, held in Azerbaijan in February 2024, in addition to the report of its delegation's participation in the Fourth Counter-Terrorism Coordination Meeting, convened in Vienna in October 2023. In conclusion, HE the Speaker of the Shura Council briefed the council on the participation of the Council's delegation under his chairmanship in the 36th conference of the Arab Inter-Parliamentary Union (AIPU), held in Algeria on Sunday, noting the topics and issues that were of interest to the conference. Copy 27/05/2024 10

content: [스포츠한국 이혜영 기자] 그룹 에스파(aespa/지젤 윈터 닝닝 카리나)가 27일 오후 서울 용산구 블루스퀘어에서 열린 첫 정규 앨범 ‘아마겟돈’(Armageddon) 미디어 쇼케이스에 참석하고 있다. ‘아마겟돈’은 에스파가 데뷔 4년 만에 처음으로 선보이는 정규 앨범으로 더블 타이틀 곡 ‘아마겟돈’과 ‘슈퍼노바’(Supernova)를 비롯한 다채로운 매력의 총 10곡이 수록되어 있다. 타이틀 곡 ‘아마겟돈’은 무게감이 느껴지는 사운드와 거칠고 절제된 음색이 돋보이는 힙합 댄스곡으로, 가사에는 각기 다른 세계 속 다른 ‘나’를 만나 완전한 ‘나’로 거듭난다는 메시지를 담았다.

title: Guardians' José Ramírez Says He's 'Better Than Barry Bonds' After Bases-Loaded Walk
creator: Adam Wells
description: Cleveland Guardians star José Ramírez is known for being extremely confident, so it's not a surprise he compared himself very favorably to one of the best...
content: Cleveland Guardians star José Ramírez is known for being extremely confident, so it's not a surprise he compared himself very favorably to one of the best players in MLB history. On the latest episode of the Cleveland Baseball Talk Podcast (starts at 19:05 mark), Paul Hoynes explained that he was talking to Ramírez about receiving the Barry Bonds treatment when he drew a four pitch bases-loaded walk in the top of the sixth inning of Sunday's 5-4 win over the Los Angeles Angels. "I'm better than Barry Bonds," Ramírez responded. The Angels didn't give Ramírez the full Bonds treatment because Bonds' most famous walk with the bases loaded was meant to be intentional. During a game against the Arizona Diamondbacks on May 28, 1998, D-Backs manager Buck Showalter ordered Bonds to be intentionally walked with two outs, the bases loaded and his team holding an 8-6 lead over the San Francisco Giants. The move paid off because Brent Mayne followed Bonds by lining out to end the game with an 8-7 win for Arizona. Ramírez's walk turned out to be the difference in the game. It gave the Guardians a 5-2 lead at the time and they held on to win for their ninth straight victory overall. It's not hard to figure out why Angels manager Ron Washington didn't want to pitch to Ramírez in that situation. The five-time All-Star is hitting .325/.388/.766 with as many homers as strikeouts (10) in his last 20 games dating back to May 5. Ramírez hit three homers in the first two games of the weekend series against Los Angeles. He was hitless on Sunday, but still got on base twice via walks, drove in a run and scored a run in the win. The Guardians have been one of the most pleasant surprises so far this season. They enter Monday with the best record in the American League (36-17). Their current nine-game winning streak is the team's longest since their AL-record 22-game streak in 2017. Ramírez doesn't quite have as many accolades as Bonds. He's still chasing his first MVP award, so winning seven of them seems like it will be out of the equation. But when it comes to active big leaguers who teams would prefer not to face in clutch situations, Ramírez is likely to be very high on that list based on his current hot streak and long track record of sustained excellence.

title: Plymouth stabbing suspect released from hospital, held without bail until arraignment Tuesday
creator: John Hilliard
Erin Douglas
description: Jared Ravizza, 26, is due to be arraigned Tuesday in Plymouth District Court on charges including assault with intent to murder, and two counts of assault and battery with a dangerous weapon in connection with the stabbings, according to prosecutors.
content: PLYMOUTH — The Chilmark man prosecutors said stabbed two workers at a local McDonald’s, then injured himself when he crashed his car during a State Police pursuit in Sandwich Saturday night, was held without bail Monday after he was released from the hospital, according to the Plymouth District Attorney’s office. Jared Ravizza, 26, is due to be arraigned Tuesday in Plymouth District Court on charges including assault with intent to murder, and two counts of assault and battery with a dangerous weapon in connection with the stabbings, prosecutors have said. Officials Monday released few new details about the investigation into the attacks, which State Police and Braintree police have said may be connected to the stabbing of four girls at the AMC Braintree 10 theater at about 6 p.m. Saturday, about an hour before the McDonald’s attack. Advertisement The attacks occurred at the McDonald’s location at the Route 3 service plaza around 7 p.m. Saturday. Prosecutors said surveillance video appears to show Ravizza grab a 28-year-old man working at the drive through window, and stab him with a large knife. Ravizza then parked his car, entered the restaurant, and stabbed a 21-year-old woman who also worked there, prosecutors said. After the attacks, Ravizza got back into his black 2018 Porsche Macan and fled the scene. A witness reported the car’s plates to State Police and troopers tried to pull Ravizza over, but he wouldn’t stop, authorities said. Ravizza crashed his vehicle in Sandwich, and he was arrested by troopers and local police around 7:15 p.m., officials said. He was taken to South Shore Hospital for treatment of non-life-threatening injuries, and had remained in the hospital Sunday. The district attorney’s spokesperson did not have information about Ravizza’s attorney Monday, and no court files were available online. Ravizza is referred to using male pronouns on a professional website and in court papers. Ravizza uses “she” on Instagram. Advertisement At the McDonald’s location in Plymouth Monday, the restaurant was operating normally, with little sign of the chaos that unfolded less than two days earlier. Two managers on duty at the restaurant, who declined to be identified because they were not authorized to speak about the event, both said that the stabbing was a “very scary” situation. They said the two employees who were injured in the stabbing had been discharged from a hospital and were in stable condition, and declined to provide any further details. In an emailed statement Monday, Mark McBee, a McDonald’s Franchisee who owns and operates several McDonald’s restaurants in the region, said he was grateful to law enforcement for their quick response to the stabbing incident at the restaurant. “We are shocked and devastated by this senseless act of violence,” McBee said. “The safety of our crew and customers is always our top priority.” McDonald’s did not provide further details about the health condition of the workers. On Sunday, Lisa Dembowski — the mother of three of the girls injured in the theater attack — said the girls were fine physically, but remained terrified following their ordeal. Dembowski’s twin 9-year-olds were injured, along with her 17-year-old and their friend. Dembowski criticized AMC staff for failing to immediately respond to the stabbings, and said employees initially didn’t believe the girls were stabbed. Her oldest daughter was the one who called police for help, she said. Advertisement “I give her an enormous amount of credit, because in my mind ... her and her friend kept the two little ones completely calm,” Dembowski said. AMC Theatres, in a statement sent Monday, said the company was saddened by Saturday’s “senseless act of violence,” and are reaching out to the girls’ families privately. The company said it has started a review of the incident. “Based on theatre associate accounts and video footage, the theatre team jumped into action immediately, calling emergency services and administering aid to the victims,” the statement said. “A visible security presence will be in place at this location for the immediate future.” Saturday’s stabbings came about six weeks after Ravizza attacked his father in their West Tisbury home, according to court filings. Ravizza was charged with assault and battery on a family or household member, and the case was directed to pretrial diversion. His father said Ravissa had suffered a “mental break” and attacked him, according to a police report on file at Edgartown District Court. West Tisbury police took Ravizza to Martha’s Vineyard Hospital for a mental health evaluation, but Ravizza “did not meet their standards to be held,′′ the police report said. The hospital is part of the Mass General Brigham system, and a spokesperson declined to answer questions Monday about Ravizza’s evaluation due to patient privacy laws. Along with the stabbings, Ravizza was sought by law enforcement for “other incidents,” according to the Plymouth district attorney’s office, which did not provide additional details. Advertisement Connecticut State Police said a suspect sought in connection with a fatal stabbing in the town of Deep River had been arrested by Massachusetts authorities Saturday. The agency on Monday declined to provide further details or say on Sunday whether there was a connection between Ravizza and the Connecticut death. John Hilliard can be reached at john.hilliard@globe.com . Erin Douglas can be reached at erin.douglas@globe.com . Follow her @erinmdouglas23 .

title: Jubilations Galore At Ubiaja As Esan South LG Pays N70,000 New Minimum Wage
creator: Francis Onoiribholo
description: The Esan South East Local Government Council of Edo State, led by Hon. Louis Imhandegbelo has been given kudos for being the first local government council in the state to pay the new minimum wage of N70,000 to workers. The council’s implimentation of the new minimum wage has drawn widespread jubilations across the length and [...]
content: The Esan South East Local Government Council of Edo State, led by Hon. Louis Imhandegbelo has been given kudos for being the first local government council in the state to pay the new minimum wage of N70,000 to workers. The council’s implimentation of the new minimum wage has drawn widespread jubilations across the length and breadth of the local government area. The council workers were seen singing and dancing on Monday at Ubiaja, the council headquarters, praising governor Godwin Obaseki soon after receiving the month of May salaries. Some of them were said to have been dumbfounded on receiving the unexpected bank alerts reflecting the newly established N70,000 minimum wage in Edo State from their various banks. Governor Godwin Obaseki in his speech on May 1st, 2024, to mark this year’s workers day announced N70,000 new minimum wage for Edo State workers which was paid this month by the state government. The development has garnered accolades both within and beyond the borders of Nigeria. The chairman of Esan South East Local Government Council, Louis Imhandegbelo while expressing his gratitude to Governor Godwin Obaseki said, “today, May 27, 2024, my council has paid the new minimum wage to workers and praises should go to God and the governor who believed that the workers were no longer getting things easy since the removal of fuel subsidy by the Federal government”. “As you can see, upon receiving their May salaries, which reflected the new wage structure, the workers are very happy and are jubilating, I asked them to continue to pray for the governor to end his tenure successfully”. Hon. Imhandegbelo however affirmed his commitment to fostering policies that enhance workers satisfaction, promote community development, and bring joy to the people of Esan South East.

title: Nigerian Army confirms reopening of Abuja Banex Plaza
creator: Ibrahim Ramalan
description: The Nigerian Army, on Monday, confirmed the immediate reopening of the popular Abuja Banex Plaza following an understanding between the authorities, plaza management and traders’ association. The plaza had been shut for over a week following a mob attack on some personnel of the Nigerian army by unidentified hoodlums on May 18. This is contained [...]The post Nigerian Army confirms reopening of Abuja Banex Plaza appeared first on Daily Nigerian.
content: The Nigerian Army, on Monday, confirmed the immediate reopening of the popular Abuja Banex Plaza following an understanding between the authorities, plaza management and traders’ association. The plaza had been shut for over a week following a mob attack on some personnel of the Nigerian army by unidentified hoodlums on May 18. This is contained in a statement by the Director, Army Public Relations, Maj.-Gen. Onyema Nwachukwu, on Monday in Abuja. Mr Nwachucku said a high-level meeting was convened in the Office of the National Security Adviser including the Principal General Staff Officer to the NSA, Commissioner of Police FCT and the FCT Director of the Department of State Services. Others on the panel, according to him are the Leadership and Management of Banex Plaza, a Representative from the Directorate of Abuja Environmental Protection Board, and the National Chairman of the Mobile Phone Traders Association. He said the primary objective of the meeting was to identify and apprehend the perpetrators and ensure the continued security of the Federal Capital Territory. “The following resolutions were agreed upon: Immediate reopening of Banex Plaza to the public and the leadership of Banex Plaza is instructed to lock up Shop C93 with immediate effect. “The owners of the shop who orchestrated the mob attack on the soldiers are to be arrested and handed over to the Nigerian Police. “Market leaders are to remain vigilant and report any remaining perpetrators to the authorities. “Furthermore, the two individuals already arrested have been handed over to the headquarters of the Nigerian Army Corps of Military Police for further action. “The Nigerian army will also thoroughly investigate the circumstances surrounding the presence of its personnel at the plaza and the subsequent attack,” he said. Mr Nwachukwu reiterated that acts of violence against military personnel were not only condemnable but also pose a significant threat to national security and public order. He urged members of the public to exercise caution and restraint when interacting with military personnel and other security operatives, especially when they are in uniform. According to him, there are established channels for reporting grievances or misconduct by personnel to the appropriate authorities. “It is imperative that these channels are utilized to maintain order and respect for those who serve and protect our nation. “The Nigerian army remains committed to ensuring safety and security of all citizens and will continue to work diligently to prevent such incidents in the future,” he added. title: State will dish out rebates to drivers from $450million pot within 7 days – find out if you automatically get cashback
creator: Kristen Brown
content: COMMUTERS can see a refund automatically issued to their account as part of a $450 million benefits package to frequent toll road users. The program is running for the second year in a row and run until early next year. Florida Governor Ron DeSantis brought the state's Toll Relief Program back to reward commuters with SunPass or other state transponders who frequently use toll roads. The Sunshine State is allocating $450 million in funds to reward commuters in hopes of easing the financial burden of commuting. "That is a way for us to provide relief for folks, given that we’ve been in this inflationary period," said DeSantis, quoted by FOX affiliate WTVT . "You’ve got groceries and all these other things." Last year, the program reportedly saved 1.2 million drivers a total of $500 million in toll fees . Each driver then saved around $400 a year, thanks to the program. "Every little bit helps," a driver said on camera. Patty Shay, who told the outlet she crosses over a toll road on an average of four to five times a day, said she'd be excited to see a discount come her way. "I'd be more than happy to get a reduction on the tolls," she said. For Shay, it wasn't just the tolls that made commuting costly. "The gas adds up," she said. "The tolls add up. I can’t even tell you how much I spend in tolls over a month. It’s quite a lot." Therefore, drivers like Shay who cross a toll road more than 35 times per month can expect to see a rebate coming in May. The program starts this week and will run until March 2025. Last year when the program was announced, users had mixed feelings about the parameters for drivers to meet the discount. "So, someone who drivers through 34 tolls a month is going to purposely go through a toll to get the rebate," a viewer of the announcement wrote. Another viewer was thankful for the relief, even if it was small. "Every little bit helps in today's economy," they wrote. "Thank you, Governor DeSantis!" Other drivers, though, disagreed with tolls. "You know what, they need to take the tolls out and just make them straight roads," wrote a viewer. Someone else made light of the situation with some backhanded humor. "Next they're going to make us pay to walk in the parks," they said.
